info.game_comments: J! round and 17 clues of DJ! round only.

(1, 1).clue: The trains of the Uyuni-Pulcayo Railway in Bolivia still use this type of engine

(2, 1).clue: In '86 parade, the Chipmunks rode a "floloon", a combination of these 2 parade standards

(3, 1).clue: "Shingle" is a word in this language

(4, 1).clue: In 1986, Martin Short was part of this title trio

(5, 1).clue: Probably named for Roman goddess who protects women, it's still thought luckiest month for weddings

(6, 1).clue: Current majority party in the House--of Representatives

(1, 2).clue: Inca Kola, touted as having "the natural flavor", originated in this country

(2, 2).clue: With high winds in 1956, only this rodent balloon had the might to make it to the parade's end

(3, 2).clue: It's just the thing to follow day

(5, 2).clue: A 16th c. quote says "marriages are made here" "& consumated on Earth"

(6, 2).clue: The number of representatives a state has in the House depends on this

(1, 3).clue: Near death, this liberator wrote "The most sensible action to take in (Latin) America is to emigrate"

(2, 3).clue: The 1st time this group of toe-tapping women lined up & high kicked in a Macy's Parade was in 1958

(4, 3).clue: The Brothers Gibb were very big in this 1978 musical based on Beatles' music
(4, 3).correct response: Sgt. Pepper\'s Lonely Hearts Club Band

(5, 3).clue: Of Jerry Lewis, Jerry Lee Lewis, or Shari Lewis, the 1 who married a 13-year-old cousin

(6, 3).clue: Rescinding a 19th c. ban, a new rule allows House members to mention this "other body" by name

(3, 4).clue: Planet found near the edge, not the heart, of the galaxy

(5, 4).clue: Frank Burns went AWOL when she married Lt. Colonel Donald Penobscott

(6, 4).clue: He took over Tip O'Neill's spot as speaker

(3, 5).clue: A knight's weapon for a clean kill

(4, 5).clue: Actor who appeared in every movie mentioned in this category

(1, 1).clue: Fluid containing erythrocytes, leukocytes, platelets, & plasma

(3, 1).clue: He sings "I wear the black for the poor & beaten down, livin' on the hopeless hungry side of town"
